alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 07 at 2:52PM MDT until July 08 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, UPPER RIO GRANDE AND LOWER CHAMA RIVER VALLEY, AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE WITH DRY LIGHTNING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT SATURDAY FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, UPPER RIO GRANDE AND LOWER CHAMA RIVER VALLEY, AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS. LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE WITH DRY LIGHTNING... .Strong and gusty west winds will develop once again Saturday afternoon while relative humidity values drop to below 15 percent in many locations, and high temperatures soar a few to 12 degrees above average with a high Haines Index of 6. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), North Central Mountains (Zone 120), West Central Mountains (Zone 105) and Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121) from noon to 8 pm MDT today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with occasional gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 15 percent with the higher relative humidity values above 8500 feet. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains
